Scott Gottlieb, MD on Twitter

‚ÄúNew preprint on Covid impact in Gauteng. During #Omicron wave 17.68% of all recorded hospital admissions were children and teens under 20 years, vs 3.97% during second wave, 3.52% during third (Delta) wave. 5.8% of children and teens are vaxxed in Gauteng https://t.co/UhX1QyK1UU‚Äù

item.title: 1/4 of the death rate from Delta there
item.description:
Andrew Lilley on Twitter

‚ÄúThe most important question for capacity to handle the Omicron wave is the progression of cases from hospitalised to ICU and death. In South Africa the progression from hospitalised to ICU and death for Omicron was 20%-25% of the rate of Delta. Preprint: https://t.co/3l1yxpURqR‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/andrewlilley_au/status/1476581027938140162

The Single-Staircase Radicals Have a Good Point, Slate, Henry Grabar, December 23, 2021 Most American apartment buildings over four stories are required to include two means of egress from every apartment. In Canada, the height limit of a single-stair building is just two stories. The purported reason for such rules is fire safety, though there‚Äôs no evid‚Ä¶

USSR 1922-1991, USA 1776-2025?
item.description:
Thirty years ago today the Soviet Union came to an end. This is not an occasion for triumphalism. It is a warning. Stagnation, or the absence of a future, was the underlying Soviet problem. Stalinism had created temporary social mobility in the Soviet Union, if at the cost of millions of deaths and the creation of the largest prison system in the world‚Ä¶

URL: https://snyder.substack.com/p/ussr-1922-1991-usa-1776-2025?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: High Patriarchy

item.title: My 2021 in Writing
item.description:
This is going to be a different one, and open to non-subscribers. I like to take the end of the year to reflect on my various projects, usually on my personal blog. This year, I thought I would look back on my writing here at The End of Safety. I beg your indulgence for putting this in your inboxes, if you‚Äôre a subscriber‚Ä¶

URL: https://endofsafety.substack.com/p/my-2021-in-writing?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: High Patriarchy

item.title: The Black Men of Harvard ‚Äò63
item.description:
Ivy League Universities today are known as the epicenter of elite progressivism within academia. But prior to modern DEI movements that dominate today‚Äôs campuses, places like Harvard were actively hostile to people of color, especially Black men. Even today, Harvard‚Äôs Black student population remains steady at about 8‚Ä¶

URL: https://bookmarkedreads.substack.com/p/lastnegroesatharvard?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: High Patriarchy

item.title: Human history in the very long run
item.description:
Like a lot of people who write about politics, I‚Äôve been interested in history for a long time. That‚Äôs mostly meant the history of relatively recent events in the west ‚Äî things like Eric Foner‚Äôs book on the ideology of the early Republican Party or nationalism and revolution in the 19th century Habsburg Empire. But more recently I‚Äôve been getting interested in some topics in the distant past like the‚Ä¶

URL: https://www.slowboring.com/p/human-history-in-the-very-long-run?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: High Patriarchy

item.title: Ending Safety as a Writer and a Reader
item.description:
When I started The End of Safety, I was hoping to name it based on some phrase in James Baldwin‚Äôs great essay, ‚ÄúThe White Man‚Äôs Guilt.‚Äù The first time I read that essay, and every time since, I have been drawn to Baldwin‚Äôs description of ‚Äúthose who imagine that history flatters them‚Äù as being ‚Äúimpaled on their history like a butterfly on a pin‚Äù thereby ‚Ä¶
